data.title: The Dirt (2019)
data.meta_description: The story of Mötley Crüe and their rise from the Sunset Strip club scene of the early 1980s to superstardom.
data.text:
As Andy Warhol famously never said: “In the future, every arena-sized music act of the 20th century will get its own ‘Bohemian Rhapsody’ for 115 minutes.” The truth of those apocryphal words was obvious even before the execrable Queen biopic grossed almost a billion dollars; the age of infinite content doesn’t offer enough bandwidth for actual creation, so most of our pop culture has to be exhumed from the past (a phenomenon made literal by the sustained explosion of true crime stories). It was all fun and games — sequels and reboots — until someone figured out that music could be a magic bullet for mainstream biopics, and then — wham! — the next thing we knew, Rami Malek had…

Squirt: The Movie

Obviously, I’m an expert on all things Mötley Crüe, since I had a poster of The Crüe on my wall when I was in 4th Grade. (I’m talking about myself)

The Dirt is a work of fiction, not to be taken as fact. A lot of Crüe history is ignored (The Crüe had a singer before Vince) or the timeline isn’t correct. (Mick’s hip surgery) But, that’s ok. I doubt you’re watching The Dirt for a factual lesson on the life of Mötley Crüe. However, you can pick out the almost fatal flaw in each member: Nikki’s drug habit, Mick’s health, Tommy’s temper and Vince’s personal tragedies. They all get attention, since the movie shifts perspectives, all…

lol this movie is a mess but that’s kinda what it needed to be given the hedonistic subject matter. Compared to the book this came across a little... tame... but still, with that said I gotta give this mess credit... right from the get go I knew this wasn’t going to shy away from specific moments like a certain other music bio pic did last year... this opens with Tommy Lee going down on a girl at a party and making her squirt across the room and that’s interspersed with a young Nikki Sixx cutting himself in front of his mom, calling the police on her and saying she stabbed him lol.

The music bio pic cliches are here but…
